Package com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport

UPA Transport API package provides classes and interfaces for distributing messages across a TCP/IP based reliable network including Transport, Channel and Server.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AcceptOptions
    UPA Accept Options used in the Server.accept(AcceptOptions, Error) call.
    BindOptions
    UPA Bind Options used in the Transport.bind(BindOptions, Error) call.
    Channel
    The UPA Channel is used to represent a connection that can send or receive information across a network.
    ChannelInfo
    UPA Channel Info available through Channel.info(ChannelInfo, Error) method call.
    ComponentInfo
    Connected Component Information, used to identify components from across the connection.
    ConnectOptions
    UPA Connect Options used in the Transport.connect(ConnectOptions, Error) call.
    CredentialsInfo
    Options used for configuring proxy credentials, which might be needed during a tunneling connection.
    EncryptDecryptHelpers
    With some ConnectionTypes, a key is exchanged upon successful connection establishment.
    Error
    Many of the UPA Transport Package methods take a parameter for returning detailed error information.
    InitArgs
    UPA Initialize Arguments used in the Transport.initialize(InitArgs, Error) call.
    InProgInfo
    Information for the In Progress Connection State of Channel.init(InProgInfo, Error).
    If a backward compatibility reconnection occurs, the socket channel may change.
    LibraryVersionInfo
    Library Version Information to be populated with Transport library version info.
    MCastOpts
    Options used for configuring multicast specific transport options (ConnectionTypes.RELIABLE_MCAST).
    MCastStats
    Multicast statistics returned by Channel.info(ChannelInfo, Error) call.
    Protocol  
    ReadArgs
    UPA Read Arguments used in the Channel.read(ReadArgs, Error) call.
    SegmentedNetworkInfo
    Options used for configuring a segmented network (separate send and receive networks).
    SeqMCastOpts
    Options used for configuring Sequenced Multicast specific transport options (ConnectionTypes.SEQUENCED_MULTICAST).
    Server
    The UPA Server class is used to represent a server that is listening for incoming connection requests.
    ServerInfo
    UPA Server Info returned by Server.info(ServerInfo, Error) call.
    ShmemOpts
    Options used for configuring shared memory specific transport options (ConnectionTypes.UNIDIR_SHMEM).
    TcpOpts
    Options used for configuring TCP specific transport options (ConnectionTypes.SOCKET, ConnectionTypes.ENCRYPTED, ConnectionTypes.HTTP).
    TransportBuffer
    UPA buffer used by transport layer.
    TunnelingInfo
    Options used for configuring a tunneling connection.
    UnifiedNetworkInfo
    Options used for configuring a unified/fully connected mesh network.
    WriteArgs
    UPA Write Arguments used in the Channel.write(TransportBuffer, WriteArgs, Error) call.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ChannelState
    UPA Channel states.
    CompressionTypes
    UPA Supported Compression types.
    ConnectionTypes
    UPA Connection types are used in several areas of the transport.
    InProgFlags
    Flags for the InProgress state.
    IoctlCodes
    UPA IOCtl codes for Channel.ioctl(int, Object, Error), Channel.ioctl(int, int, Error), Server.ioctl(int, Object, Error) and Server.ioctl(int, int, Error).
    ReadFlags
    UPA Read Flags passed into the Channel.read(ReadArgs, Error) method call.
    Transport
    UPA transport is used by an OMM Interactive Provider to create listening sockets and by OMM consumer and NIP applications to establish outbound connections to a listening socket.
    TransportFactory
    Factory for Transport package objects
    TransportReturnCodes
    Return codes associated with transport package.
    WriteFlags
    UPA Write Flags passed into the Channel.write(TransportBuffer, WriteArgs, Error) method call.
    WritePriorities
    UPA Write Priorities passed into the Channel.write(TransportBuffer, WriteArgs, Error) method call.

Package com.thomsonreuters.upa.transport Description

UPA Transport API package provides classes and interfaces for distributing messages across a TCP/IP based reliable network including Transport, Channel and Server.
